helpers

Class DataFetchHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • helpers.DataFetchHelper

  • public class DataFetchHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    This helper class handles connecting to RBNB, collects the data and wraps it in a custom RBNB object.
    Author:
    jdk85
    See Also:
    RBNBObject, XYDataPointObject, SegaDataServlet

    • Field Summary

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DataFetchHelper(java.lang.String serverAddress)
      Constructor This method adds a port number if not included, otherwise it just stores the server address to the local variable serverAddress.

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        public java.lang.String connect(java.lang.String clientName)
        Opens connection to RBNB. Method will connect to the RBNB that's running on serverAddress sent in to the constructor and return a human-readable String that indicates the status of the connection.
        Parameters:
        clientName -
        Returns:
        String indicating success or failure in connecting to RBNB server

      • getData

        public java.util.ArrayList<RBNBChannelObject> getData(java.lang.String[] channelNames,
                                             double start,
                                             double duration,
                                             java.lang.String ref)
        This function returns an array list containing RBNB channel data objects.
        Parameters:
        channelNames - - handles retrieving RBNB data for multiple channels
        start - - start time for RBNB request command
        duration - - duration for RBNB request command
        ref - - string referring to RBNB request type
        Returns:
        This function returns a string with RBNB timestamps and data points formatted so that it can be parsed easily by the calling JSP

      • disconnect

        public java.lang.String disconnect()
        This method closes the RBNB sink connection.
        Returns:
        A message saying the sink connection was closed

      • findInArray

        public int findInArray(java.lang.String[] arr,
              java.lang.String value)
        This is a helper method for getData().
        Parameters:
        arr - - The string array to be searched
        value - - The value to find in the array
        Returns:
        The index of the value is returned if it is found, otherwise a -1 is returned

      • getValidTimeInterval

        public java.util.Date[] getValidTimeInterval(java.lang.String[] channelNames)
                                      throws com.rbnb.sapi.SAPIException,
                                             java.lang.Exception
        This method is used to fetch the absolute start and end dates of a given set of channels. It is used by the web app to fill in the start/end data intervals when fetching data by date. This function specifies a valid date range for a given set of data, but takes the longest possible range over all selected channels. For example, if channel one spans June 5th to June 8th and channel two spans June 12th to June 24th, the valid date range returned will be June 5th to June 24th.
        Parameters:
        channelNames -
        Returns:
        interval
        Throws:
        com.rbnb.sapi.SAPIException
        java.lang.Exception
